
# EVEN RSA CAN BE BROKEN???

- Algo notorio, n es par 

```
❯ nc verbal-sleep.picoctf.net 60565

N: 20333980878553510168805610590372789314097768764410507198700749965963413855114394000267051300689876014250767384843775092576454049322005709954605987726919334
e: 65537
cyphertext: 2593547573384906999475508272964394163212118604503687952738930794390746313498869505999993886879462755003368161001446810670849795605704746608609841086032677
 ~/Downloads/tmp/picoctf2025/crypto 
❯

```

- por lo tanto n esta dividida entre 2 conforma los digitos p y q

```
┌──(venv)─(kali㉿kali)-[~/RsaCtfTool]
└─$ python3
Python 3.13.2 (main, Feb  5 2025, 01:23:35) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> p = 2
>>> q = 10166990439276755084402805295186394657048884382205253599350374982981706927557197000133525650344938007125383692421887546288227024661002854977302993863459667
>>> 
>>> p * q
20333980878553510168805610590372789314097768764410507198700749965963413855114394000267051300689876014250767384843775092576454049322005709954605987726919334
>>> tn = (1-p)*(1-q)
>>> tn
10166990439276755084402805295186394657048884382205253599350374982981706927557197000133525650344938007125383692421887546288227024661002854977302993863459666
>>> e = 65537
>>> d = pow(e,-1,tn)
>>> 
>>> c = 2593547573384906999475508272964394163212118604503687952738930794390746313498869505999993886879462755003368161001446810670849795605704746608609841086032677
>>> 
>>> n = p * q
>>> m = pow(c,d,n)
>>> m
3030612722376619015339251852200174143198160267120074875669937770226045
 
>>> bytes.fromhex(hex(m)[2:]).decode()
'picoCTF{tw0_1$_pr!m3f81fef0a}'
>>> 

```

pip3 install pycryptodome
pip3 install setuptools
